subtitle: Homemade muffins served warm with lashings of cream are such a treat.

method.text: Preheat  oven to 200°C. Sift the flour, cocoa powder, bicarbonate of soda, baking powder and salt into a mixing bowl. Stir in the soft brown sugar and caster sugar.

Beat the egg with the milk and butter. Add to the dry ingredients and stir until the ingredients are evenly combined but the mixture is still slightly lumpy. Carefully fold in the chopped plain and white chocolate.
Spoon the mixture into a muffin tin lined with paper cases. Cook in the oven for 20 min or until risen and firm to the touch.
Cool slightly. Then remove from the tin. Serve warm, or leave to cool completely on a wire rack.
